Package ohos.agp.components

Class ListComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.components.Component
      • ohos.agp.components.ComponentContainer
        • ohos.agp.components.ListComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentParent

    public class ListComponent
extends ComponentContainer
    A container class used to display lists that can be scrolled up and down on the screen.
    Since:
    7

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  ListComponent.BounceBackListener
      Implements listening for changes in the rebound status, including rebound start, rebound in progress, and rebound end.
      static interface  ListComponent.CachePolicyListener
      Implements listening for adding components to the ListComponentPool.
      static class  ListComponent.ListLayoutConfig
      Inherits from ComponentContainer.LayoutConfig and provides methods to enable a component in the ListComponent to access the corresponding ComponentOwner.
      static interface  ListComponent.OnComponentBoundStatusChangeListener
      Implements listening for status changes of the ListComponent.
      static class  ListComponent.OnFlingListener
      Implements listening for a fling.
      static class  ListComponent.ReboundEffectParams
      Provides parameters to implement the rebound effect.

      • addComponent

        public void addComponent​(Component childComponent,
                         int index,
                         ComponentContainer.LayoutConfig layoutConfig)
        Adds a component and sets its layout parameters and location.
        Overrides:
        addComponent in class ComponentContainer
        Parameters:
        childComponent - Indicates the child component to add.
        index - Indicates where to add the child component. The value -1 means to add the child component to the end of the queue.
        layoutConfig - Indicates the layout parameters of the child component.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - Method is not allowed in ListContainer.

      • addComponent

        public void addComponent​(Component childComponent,
                         int index)
        Adds a component to the specified position.

        If no layout parameters are set for this child component, the default layout parameters of ComponentContainer are used.

        Overrides:
        addComponent in class ComponentContainer
        Parameters:
        childComponent - Indicates the child component to add.
        index - Indicates where to add the child component. The value -1 means to add the component to the end. If a number greater than the value of getChildCount() is provided, a runtime exception is returned.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - Method is not allowed in ListContainer.

      • removeComponent

        public void removeComponent​(Component component)
        Removes a child component from the parent component.
        Specified by:

      • setIsFixedSize

        public void setIsFixedSize​(boolean isFixedSize)
        Sets whether the provider of this ListComponent has a fixed size.

        This method can be used to improve layout performance when the provider changes.

        Parameters:
        isFixedSize - Specifies whether the provider has a fixed size. The value true means that the provider has a fixed size, indicating that the provider changes do not affect the size of the ListComponent; the value false means the opposite.

      • switchProvider

        public void switchProvider​(Provider provider,
                           boolean deleteAndReuseComponents)
        Replaces the provider of this ListComponent with a new one.

        Before replacing a provider, you can use the deleteAndReuseComponents parameter to determine whether to reclaim all the child components in the ListComponent.

        Parameters:
        provider - Indicates the new provider. The value null means that no provider will be set.
        deleteAndReuseComponents - Specifies whether to reclaim all the child components in the ListComponent. The value true means to reclaim all the child components, and false means the opposite.
        Since:
        7

                                   int remainVisiblePercent)

        overscrollRate - Indicates the overscroll rate. The default value is 0.6.
